author: Shiv Sunny
text:
Social media users and rumour mongers on Friday and Saturday attempted to give a communal twist to the murder of Pankaj Narang, a dentist who was lynched by a mob in Vikaspuri on the eve of Holi over a trivial incident.

Dependra Pathak, Joint CP (South-Western Range), said the police would probe the source of rumours and would take action against the culprits.

After shunning the media on Friday, a member of Dr Narang’s family came forward on Saturday to dismiss the rumours. “Neither was the assault related to the India-Bangladesh cricket match nor was there any communal connection to it,” said Sameer Narang, the dentist’s cousin.

The rumours began to float on Friday when some social media users alleged it was a Muslim mob that lynched Dr Narang. Among the first to respond was Monika Bhardwaj, Additional DCP (West), who took to Twitter to dispel the rumours.
title: Delhi police deny communal angle to dentist’s murder
